Emetra.Command.Mediator Namespace

Summary

The Mediator pattern is a way to let objects interact without any direct coupling. Inside FastTrak it is used for a number of purposes. The Command pattern is a way to encapsulate the information needed to perform an action. In this class, that includes the Receiver (or in this case, a pseudonym for the object) upon with the command will be performed.

Top
Remarks

Some key concepts are

  • CommandName - Key element, define what the action is and who receives it.
  • Command - An instruction to perform some action. It contains parameters that define the action, as well as the name of the action itself. The command name
  • Receiver - Can accept one or more commands, in technical terms implementing the ICommandReceiver interface.
  • Mediator - Accepts registration from Receivers for specific commands that they want to handle.
